Package game

Class Bat

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.StaticBody
game.Enemy
game.Bat
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.StepListener, EventListener
public class Bat extends Enemy implements city.cs.engine.StepListener
This class is a Subclass of Enemy which is called Bat. This represents the bat entity in the game. The class is comprised of the bats Behaviour, Attributes, Movement, Direction,Sound and Health.

  • Constructor Details

    • Bat

      public Bat(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position, int EnemyHealth, float EnemySpeed)
      A Bat Entity is Constructed from these Parameters. Unique Bat Objects can be initialised with different speeds,positions or health.
      Parameters:
      world - World that the bat exists.
      position - Position of the Bat.
      EnemyHealth - Health of the Bat.
      EnemySpeed - Speed of the bat Movement.

    • batLeft

      public void batLeft()
      Using two methods that change the Way the bats Animation moves. Each time The Bats Unique sound is called. BodyImage is changed to left Animation, if the Bat is moving left.

    • batRight

      public void batRight()
      BodyImage is changed to Right animation, if the bat is not moving left.

    • setPosition

    • decrementHealth

      public int decrementHealth(int x)
      Method is used to decrement the Health of the bat.
      Overrides:
      decrementHealth in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      x - Represents the Amount to decrement health by.
      Returns:
      Returns the Updated Health of the Bat through EnemyHealth.

    • TakenHit

      public void TakenHit()
      Method that plays a Sound if the bat is Hit. Consists of a condition, if the Health is less or Equal to 0, the bat will be destroyed. Furthermore, Spawning a Point.
      Overrides:
      TakenHit in class Enemy

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Method is used to get the Health
      Specified by:
      getHealth in class Enemy
      Returns:
      Will return the current Health of the Bat.

    • playBatSound

      public void playBatSound()
      In order for the sound to not overlap, a condition has to be met where the sound is not already playing.

    • StopPlayingBatSound

      public void StopPlayingBatSound()
      Stop playing the Bat noise. initialising the audio to false each time audio has stopped.
